doc:
Robert F. Colesberry https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Colesberry 0 Robert F. "Bob" Colesberry, Jr. (March 7, 1946 – February 9, 2004) was an American film and television producer, best known as a co-creator of the television series The Wire (2002–2008) for HBO, executive producer of the miniseries The Corner (2000), and a producer for Martin Scorsese's After Hours (1985), Alan Parker's Mississippi Burning (1988), and Billy Crystal's 61* (2001). Colesberry was also an occasional actor. Robert_F._"_Bob_"_Colesberry , Jr. ( March_7_,_1946 – February_9_,_2004 ) was an_American_film_and_television_producer , best_known as a_co-creator of the_television_series The_Wire ( 2002 – 2008 ) for HBO , executive_producer of the_miniseries The_Corner ( 2000 ) , and a_producer for Martin_Scorsese 's_After_Hours ( 1985 ) , Alan_Parker 's_Mississippi_Burning ( 1988 ) , and Billy_Crystal 's 61 * ( 2001 ) . Colesberry was also an_occasional_actor .
